p: Nine types of microorganisms were obtained from the collection of the Microbiology Laboratory, School of Chemistry, of the Autonomous University of Queretaro for the evaluation of the antibacterial activities of the flower extracts (methanol and aqueous). Bacillus cereus ATCC 10876 , Bacillus subtilis ATCC 6633 , Enterococcus faecalis ATCC 51299 , Listeria monocytogenes ATCC 19115, Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923 , Streptococcus mutans ATCC 25175 (gram-positive), Escherichia coli ATCC 25922 , Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853, and Salmonella typhimurium ATCC 14028 (gram-negative) were standardized to a concentration of 10 8 CFU/mL for the antibacterial susceptibility test.
